result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P. SHIMEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Inform-Req'd Construct.Permits, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes ATCP110.03(1).
  • Failure to Describe Work/Products in Home Improvement Contract, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes ATCP110.05(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with any of the victims, Kayla Yurk, Mathilda & Donald Goeke, Mark Korleski, David Cole, Kenneth Klusmeyer, and Anna & James Malik.  

Defendant must obtain building permits for all jobs he obtains estimates on or works on.  (No permit, no work)

All proposed contracts/estimates must comply with Wisconsin Statutes and the Wisconsin Administrative Code ATCP Chapter 110; 

Defendant will provide written verification that all sources of supply are paid and no money is owing within 15 business days of completing any job or contract; 

All jobs must have a written contract or estimate. 

All funds collected from persons who accepted an estimate or contract shall be held, received and disbursed as required by Chapter 779, Wis. Stats.

timeConds.notes:
Seven (7) days, up front, under the Huber Law.   
Thirty-eight (38) days stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.
